course.title: Introduction to Machine Learning for Data Science
course.subtitle: A primer on Machine Learning for Data Science. Revealed for everyday people, by the Backyard Data Scientist.

reviews.body: Great lecture for beginners! This course definitely gives a way for me to start something with machine learning.
Quite difficult to follow without step-by-step examples. The Python crash course has too much technicla jargons.

Overall a comprehensive course. The bonus material is an act of love, but may be a little too much for the newbies. Could be better positioned as an intermediate level for those who are keen to start getting their hands into coding. Otherwise very good coverage of the topic from a Computer Science post-grad point of view. A great refresher to catch up on the progress in the field in general.

There are may tools out there and here you present a chain or pipeline which is valuable for me to assist. Thank you very much for making learning material ! ps. cant install anaconda on my business laptop ... but that's more of my problem to work around
This course really enforced key data science definitions and applications. I wished the bonus section was included separately, as I was not interested in the practical component at the moment.

Pretty good content - some of the examples at the end were a little fast to absorb but that was expected based on his intro. The models at the end are interesting but for an intro course, I wish there had been a bit more explanation about the models being used and less about plugging them into the notebook. Overall an average course but not what I expected.
Some basic fundamental in programming will ease in the understanding the content especially the bonus course and reap higher better return from the overall course

Hi - This isn't a complaint as such, and I don't usually even bother entering comments. But the section where it recommends watch it in 1080p - High Def. Maybe be more aware that other parts of the world don't have the same internet availability as US or UK. Here, in SA - we don't have fibre and internet floating around free for everyone to use, we have to pay a reasonable amount for data - so I am not going to use a chunk of it up watching an online course in HD. Like I say, the course is fine - just thought I would mention. Thanks

Hi David,

at the beginning it was very understanding.

I am very well understood, because I really have no idea, but have already researched a lot before.

Since my master's thesis is about Python, I need and want to learn it.

At the beginning it was very understandable, but at the end there was little structure and the information actually understandable but at the same time very confusing.

Thanks anyway, hope the feedback helps you.
Give a basic understanding and example of how machine learning goes. Would say it's pretty decent for someone who has no knowledge about machine learning before but would like to gain some insight.
Introduction to Machine Learning for Data Science was just that. I got the history and the crux of it. As for the bonus course, I really didn't need that much information since I don't program.
The presentations are kinda short on animation. Its a lot of talking over one picture, change picture then more talking. Not good for learning.

instructor.name: David Valentine
instructor.briefIntroduction:
Mr. David Valentine is an decorated Enterprise Architect with over seventeen years of experience in enterprise computing environments.  He currently works for the Province of Manitoba, in Canada where he is a responsible for the architecture of the Server and Mainframe compute environment. 

Mr. Valentine has a passion for Data Science, Computer Science, Machine Learning and Data Science.  As the "Backyard Data Scientist", he bring his experience and ability to simplify challenging technical topics to Data Science.  He's delighted to offer the world his first course on the Udemy platform, "Machine Learning for Data Science"
